intro: Heteropterys umbellata f. sericans, commonly known as the sericant form of the umbellate heteropterys, is a variant of a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators. This form is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral characteristics compared to the typical species.
